oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The president of the electoral college to the gentlemen voters of Herault.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter written to the male voters living in Herault, France from the president of the electoral college in Paris named Le Comte de Lally-Tolendal. The letter is meant to convince wealthy men that the newly re-instated monarchy will ensure that they are allowed to vote in an election.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lally-Tolendal, Trophime-Gérard, marquis de, 1751-1830
France. Assemblée nationale (1871-1942). Chambre des députés

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Saint-Priest, Marie Joseph Emmanuel Guignard, vicomte de, 1732-1794
Mirabeau, Marie-Emilie de Riquetti, comtesse de, 1754?-1800

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monarchy--France--History.

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794

Revolutionary literature, French.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter written by Camille Desmoulins, a member of the Paris Convention, to General Dillon, who was imprisoned at the time. This document also includes the letter from Dillon informing Desmoulins and the Convention of his wrongful imprisonment and Desmoulins's response.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from the king

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Berwick, James Fitzjames, Duke of, 1670-1734
Louis XV, King of France, 1710-1774.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The red book
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Lucile, 1770 or 71-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Book that is named "The red book," written by Lucile Duplessis, wife of Camille Desmoulins. The inscriptions at the front state who the book was written by and that in 1834, it was given to Lucile Duplessis's sister, and the remainder of the book contains poems written by Lucile Duplessis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 1
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: First edition of "The Old Franciscan" written by Camille Desmoulins that appeals to those who fight during the French Revolution in favor of a french republic and argues against the restraints put upon journalists in France.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 2
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Second edition of "The Old Franciscan" written by Camille Desmoulins that argues against the Girondins and in favor of the Jacobins and uses specific quotes, allusions, and examples to do so.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 3
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Third edition of "The Old Franciscan" that includes sketches of flowers on the cover. The journal discusses the idea that monarchies are built upon deceit and corruption while republics are more virtuous.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 4
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fourth edition of "The Old Franciscan" written to defend the third edition and argue against the monarchy of France.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 5
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fifth edition of "The Old Franciscan" that includes sketches of flowers on the cover. This edition describes why Camille Desmoulins felt he needed to write a political journal and support the Republic and the Jacobins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 6
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sixth edition of "The Old Franciscan" that includes sketches of flowers on the cover and claims that the monarchy cannot bring freedom to people the way a republic can.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old franciscan: no. 7
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Desmoulins, Camille, 1760-1794
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Seventh edition of "The Old Franciscan," which argues against those who favor monarchy and supports those who favor republic. This journal uses many specific references to Classical authors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionary literature, French.
Jacobins.
